meanings.definition: To file or arrange in an alternating sequence.
meanings.sent1: I interfiled the papers by color to make it easier to find them.
meanings.sent2: She likes to interfile her documents by date to keep them organized.
meanings.sent3: The office prankster decided to interfile the papers by size, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to interfile memories and dreams, creating a surreal experience.
meanings.sent5: The artist's paintings interfiled colors in a mesmerizing way.

meanings.definition: To insert or incorporate into a file or series.
meanings.sent1: He will interfile the new data into the existing report.
meanings.sent2: Please interfile the additional pages into the correct section of the binder.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to interfile a new recipe into the old cookbook.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to interfile with the music, creating a joyful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The writer's words interfiled seamlessly with the storyline, enhancing the plot.
